questions.question: What is the DOI of the article discussing the synthesis of highly porous isoreticular frameworks?
What method is used to estimate the influence of linker lengths on the synthesis difficulties and framework stabilities of a ternary prototype?
How many highly porous isoreticular frameworks were produced using 5x5 ligand combinations?
What is the relationship between the ligand length ratio and the difficulty in synthesizing ncb-type frameworks?
questions.answer: The ligand length ratio (dr) can be used to predict the difficulty in the synthesis of ncb-type frameworks.

questions.question: What is the maximum lattice symmetry of the ncb net mentioned in the article?
True or False: The geometry analysis approach is confirmed by the successful prediction of the outcome for a large-scale systematic synthesis with 5x5 ligand combinations.
What is the role of the relative edge length (dr) in the construction of ncb-type frameworks?
questions.answer: The relative edge length (dr) is crucial for evaluating the node geometry, which influences the construction possibility and inner tension of ncb-type frameworks.

questions.question: True or False: All synthesized isoreticular frameworks possess the same crystal structure.
What is the effect of changing the ratio of the lengths between pyridylcarboxylate and dicarboxylate on the frameworks?
questions.answer: Changing the ratio of the lengths between pyridylcarboxylate and dicarboxylate can anisotropically modulate the pore size/shape and alter the relative volume ratio between the channel and the cavities of each framework.

questions.question: True or False: The thermal stability of PCPs is solely determined by the porosity and robustness of the coordination bonds.
What is the significance of the node geometry in the thermal stability of isoreticular frameworks?
questions.answer: The node geometry, particularly the framework distortion, has a notable influence on the thermal stability of isoreticular frameworks, potentially more so than porosity.

questions.question: True or False: The adsorption properties of the isoreticular frameworks are characterized by gradually increasing total pore volumes/sizes and very different channel-cavity characteristics.
How does the host-guest interaction or confinement effect vary with pore size in hydrogen adsorption?
questions.answer: The host-guest interactions or confinement effects are stronger for smaller pore sizes, as indicated by the higher H2 uptake capacity for frameworks with smaller pores.

questions.question: True or False: The gating mechanism is the only explanation for the two-step CO2 isotherm shape observed in the isoreticular frameworks.
What mechanism is proposed to explain the two-step features in CO2 sorption isotherms of the isoreticular frameworks?
questions.answer: A capillary condensation mechanism is proposed to explain the two-step features in CO2 sorption isotherms, where the onset pressure of the step is influenced by the pore size.
